title: Mechanistic RAG-LLM-GNN for Explainable Multi-Omics Biomarker Discovery
subtitle: A Retrieval-Augmented LLM-Guided GNN for Mechanistic, Interpretable Biomarker Discovery
description: Trustworthy biomarker discovery from multi-omics requires models that are both accurate and mechanistically interpretable. This project presents a Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Model guided Graph Neural Network (RAG-LLM-GNN) for explainable multi-omics biomarker discovery, integrating heterogeneous omics data with curated molecular knowledge to yield sparse, pathway-consistent panels and causal-style rationales.
detailedDescription: The approach constructs a molecular interaction graph from public resources (e.g., STRING, Reactome, KEGG) and encodes multi-omics signals via a modality-aware GNN. A biomedical LLM, coupled with targeted retrieval from pathway databases and literature, injects mechanistic priors by shaping the objective with pathway-sparsity and evidence-alignment constraints, and by masking implausible interactions during training. The method includes a counterfactual auditing module to simulate perturbations and validate mechanistic rationales.

beginner.summary: This project helps scientists find important biomarkers in complex biological data using AI that can explain its reasoning, making discoveries more trustworthy and useful for medicine.
realWorldApplications: Precision medicine through interpretable biomarker panels
Faster drug discovery with mechanistic insights
Improved trust in AI-driven biological research

intermediate.methodology: The RAG-LLM-GNN system builds a molecular graph from curated databases, encodes omics data, and uses a biomedical LLM to inject mechanistic priors. Pathway-sparsity and evidence-alignment are enforced during training, and counterfactual auditing validates the model's explanations.
intermediate.technicalApproach: Combines GNNs for data encoding, LLMs for knowledge retrieval and prior injection, and custom loss functions for interpretability.

advanced.implementation: Implemented in PyTorch, integrating GNNs with LLM-based retrieval modules. Pathway and evidence constraints are encoded in the loss. Counterfactual auditing is performed post-training.
performanceMetrics: Improved stability and faithfulness of explanations
researchContributions: First RAG-LLM-GNN for multi-omics biomarker discovery
Open-source framework for explainable omics analysis
